channel.title: AOL Agile User Story & Bug Tracking
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of some issues

item.title: [LLU-4211] Fens "Unhandled Exception Occurred" failure
item.description:
Occasionsally, we get a fens_response of "Unhandled Exception Occurred" written to the provision_record within IMS. Now this appears to happen to all order action types (i.e. build, modify & delete). Further investigation needs to be undertaken to identify the reason for this - i.e. is it a valid response from FENS, or is it something the LLU code is writing to this table.
 
However, the implications of this could be a problem. For example, in the situation where BBMS sends us a modify order (where the member wants to move to a new product - e.g. a Max product), even though IMS is updated to reflect this, the failed response from FENS results in a MODIFY_FAILED record being inserted into the bbmsStatusUpdate table.

If this fens_response message is actually generated by FENS, then we need to re-send this provision_request rather than treating it as a failure. If it is an internal LLU message, we need to prevent this from happening. When records have been datafixed to be re-sent, they appear to complete successfully! It may be prudent to put some max number of re-tries logic for this.

item.title: [LLU-4216] Update Weblogic Config changes
item.description:
All
 
Can we please have JIRAs raised to make erssential config changes to the build files for Weblogic in BBMS, Talk and LLU. These changes are to enable our NMS to start monitroing key metrics within Weblogic and enable us to get early warning of potential Sev 1 incidents in prod. These changes DO NOT need to be made in any other Weblogic build environments.
 
1: SNMP port configured to use 181 (blue) and 191 (green)
2: Community prefix set to : lux-uksysops
3: Trap Destination changed: Host = 10.155.121.46 Community = lux-uksysops
 
Once these changes are in place we can be sure monitroing will persist after cutovers and I will write the relevant probes. Please send me the JIRA references and advise on when they are complete.
 
Phil H

item.title: [LLU-4104] Merge -Deadlock Servlet processes records which are in an end state
item.description:
There are some orders in Service DB that have been cancelled but still have downstream_status_code set to "INV_2050" and consequently will get picked up by the deadlock servlet.

The problem is that inventory assigns a new tie pair - even though no Order is sent to EMP.

The servelet should check that the order is not in an end state before attempting to reassign.
item.summary: Merge -Deadlock Servlet processes records which are in an end state

comments.comment: Moving this to the backlog to schedule in at a later date

item.title: [LLU-4179] MODIFY Orders stay COMMITTTED if no changes required on FENS.
item.description:
If a MODIFY request is received, but the LSIP is already on the requested Profile/Product etc then no provision_record will be created in IMS, and consequently the order wil not get updateed to COMPLETED.

The order will never complete because there is no provision_record record to be processed by the FENS servlet, and as a result no success response to be sent back to SM.
item.summary: MODIFY Orders stay COMMITTTED if no changes required on FENS.

item.title: [LLU-3951] Servlets to automatically identify deadlocked product orders and send JMS messages to correct the problem to Inventory.
item.description:
Create a servlet or servlets to query the service management database for deadlocked product orders and, for the orders found, generate appropriate JMS messages and send them into Inventory.

These servlets need to be blockable and should make sure they have all neccessary information before sending JMS messages and should not send messages if, for whatever reason, all neccessary appropriate information cannot be retrieved.

Cron jobs then need to be set up for these servlets to run at appropiate times / intervals during the day.

This will relieve us of the need to manually do these fixes as part of the daily health checks.
item.summary: Servlets to automatically identify deadlocked product orders and send JMS messages to correct the problem to Inventory.

comments.comment: This servlet should be renamed once buisness decides on a better name.

For QA:

Confirm that this can be blocked/unblocked through the Admin UI and that the TaskRunnerLog table in the DB is being updated correctly

Example URL to launch servlet:

/tasks/JMSDatafixSlaveServlet?message_type=decommission_deadlocked
/tasks/JMSDatafixSlaveServlet?message_type=provision_deadlocked
/tasks/JMSDatafixSlaveServlet?message_type=reconfigure_deadlocked
/tasks/JMSDatafixSlaveServlet?message_type=reassign_deadlocked
/tasks/JMSDatafixSlaveServlet?message_type=reserve_deadlocked
ReOpened to change the task to by default without an argument run the different tasks after each other (not in parallel)
Asked Doug Thorndyke to start writing script for this servlet
Completed dev and commited to trunk - still need to commit to branch...
Code commited to both trunk and branch... (branches build No.: llu-service-management-b-100-build-2 )

Tested QA Passed

Build Number: ver_10_0_rc2
Deployment Date: 10:22-08-July-2008
Environment Name: fqa-blue
Need to be analysed before turned on
Mike raised as issue

Additional check added to make sure that only the orders that have a deadlocked journal message as the last message are sent.
Also added a new table to log message resends - resend_deadlocked_order_log
llu-service-management-build-2951

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: llu-service-management-build-2842 llu-master-build-3927. Build with new changes: llu-service-management-build-2886, llu-master-build-3994
Deadlocks being automatically picked up and fixed using JMS.

item.title: [LLU-4213] EMP - 7004 code (1052) is not being updated on bbmsStatusUpdate table.
item.description: Currently EMP codes (7001,7002,7003,7004, 7005) are all mapped correctly to northbound codes. However the bbmsStatusUpdate table is not being updated with text "Revised CCD as a narrowband cease or stop has been placed with earlier CCD" for code 7004. All the rest are populated correctly.
item.summary: EMP - 7004 code (1052) is not being updated on bbmsStatusUpdate table.

item.title: [LLU-4215] If first MAC request originating from BBMS results in Timeout because no response from EMP subsequent request is treated as duplicate and MAC not generated
item.description:
If a MAC request from BBMS results in a Timeout because no response from EMP (ie. in QA regurgitator is not running) a subsequent request for the same DN (with reurgitator running) is regarded as a Duplicate and no request is made to EMP for MAC.

Consequence of this is that if the first request gets a Timeout response (because no reply from EMP) then any subsequent request will always be treated as a Duplicate and MAC code will not be generated.
item.summary: If first MAC request originating from BBMS results in Timeout because no response from EMP subsequent request is treated as duplicate and MAC not generated

item.title: [LLU-4220] bbmsStatusUpdate table is not updated with "Order cannot be cancelled" message
item.description:
Consider the following:

1) Provide order is received from bbms
2) SM processes the order and it goes to complete (BUT BBMS haven't retrieved the OK_PROVIDED message yet)
3) BBMS sends a CANCEL for that order

In service management this CANCEL order is correctly interpreted as "Order cannot be cancelled" because orders that are in KCI3 state cannot be cancelled . However, the bbmsStatusUpdate IS NOT updated.
item.summary: bbmsStatusUpdate table is not updated with "Order cannot be cancelled" message

item.title: [LLU-4190] Provide E2E fitnesse test for BBMS Northbound Status updates
item.summary: Provide E2E fitnesse test for BBMS Northbound Status updates

comments.comment: Resolved by Alex

item.title: [LLU-4189] Improve Message sender to be able to Trawl folders for message sending

item.title: [LLU-4148] [FC-ReserveLogic] Process MLC state is jumpered to a line that is not available - SM
item.description:
As LLU Operations, I need the IMS to check the MLC upon a reserve request. If the MLC returns that the line is already jumpered (returning tie pair information) and the IMS believes that tie pair is not available (is faulty, in use, decommisioning etc), the IMS should send back a response that will contain a new 'orders to be actioned' status code. Service management should have stored this code in the downstream status code table. This is so that we can investigate the inconsistencies and decide how to appropriately continue for an order.

Notes
- acceptable tie pair states are only Available or Deconfigured

New Status Code: 2061, "MLC result inconsistent with IMS"

In ServiceManagement:
- the new code returned in the response can be mapped (is the same number) to a new InventoryCode enum in service management (see above: INV_2061)
- the state of the service should go on hold (State.ON_HOLD for the enum)
item.summary: [FC-ReserveLogic] Process MLC state is jumpered to a line that is not available - SM

comments.comment:
llu-service-management-build-2958 / llu-master-build-4110

Fireness tests:
InventoryTests/ReserveNetworkResourceTests/InventoryErrorTranslation
InventoryTests/ReserveNetworkResourceTests/InventoryMlcMismatch

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
With a DN sent into a reserve request, if
1. MLC = jumpered & IMS = faulty
2. MLC = jumpered & IMS = assigned
3. MLC = jumpered & IMS = decommissioning

we need to check that the
- order to be actioned status code for this scenario is stored in the downstream status code column (INV_2061)
- the order state is on hold

item.title: [LLU-4085] [FC-ReserveLogic] Process MLC state is jumpered and IMS believes the port is not available - IMS
item.description:
As LLU Operations, I need the IMS to check the MLC upon a reserve request. If the MLC returns that the line is already jumpered (returning tie pair information) and the IMS believes that tie pair is not available (is faulty, in use, pending etc), the IMS should send back a response that will contain a new 'orders to be actioned' status code. Service management should have stored this code in the downstream status code table. This is so that we can investigate the inconsistencies and decide how to appropriately continue for an order.

Notes:

New Status Code: 2061, "MLC result inconsistent with IMS"

In IMS:
- we currently have a status code field returned in the reserve response in case anything goes wrong (reserve_network_resource_response.vm in llu-inventory)
- we need a new response status code (see above: RESPONSE_STATUS_2061) for when the MLC believes this DN is already jumpered but the IMS thinks the tie pair returned is unavailable (assigned, faulty, pending...). This can be mapped in ResponseMapping.java (llu-common) and returned in the response message.
item.summary: [FC-ReserveLogic] Process MLC state is jumpered and IMS believes the port is not available - IMS

comments.comment:
llu-inventory-build-2965 / llu-master-build-4110

fitness tests: InventoryManagementServices/ReserveNetworkResourceLijWithFlexiCeaseOn

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
With a DN sent into a reserve request, if flexi cease is on and
1. MLC = jumpered & IMS = faulty
2. MLC = jumpered & IMS = assigned
3. MLC = jumpered & IMS = decommisioning

we need to check that the order to be actioned status code for this scenario is sent back in the response

If IMS = available, continue the process

item.title: [LLU-4197] MODIFY orders originating from BBMS that don't change the customer service remain in an interim state
item.description:
Currently when a MODIFY order is received by Service Management and its modify data is no different from the current service, it gets held in an interim state [i.e. COMMITTED].

However, even though there is nothing to be modified within IMS and FENS, the order should be completed as normal - ie complete the order and generate the bbmsStatusUpdate table entry. This is to ensure that BBMS receive a valid response from LLU.

Subsequent jira for latter releases will incorporate a rejection state in BBMS so that we can reject this instead.
item.summary: MODIFY orders originating from BBMS that don't change the customer service remain in an interim state

comments.comment:
The original code had a check where if there was no change to either the dsl or atm profiles, or the s & c tag, then no modify provision record was created. Therefore, no response was received from FENS and hence the cycle did not complete.

The code has now been changed to always create a modify record even if there are no actual changes - this has been tested against a live version of FENS and there do not appear to be any problems with doing this.

The new logic is as follows:

1. provisionRecordService.createProvisioningRecordForServlet(service.getPortPairMapping().getPortOpt(), ProvisionRecord.MODIFY, lsip, null, request.getOriginator(), service.getAtmProfile(), service.getDslProfile(), 0, 0);
2. if ((oldAtmProfile == null) || (oldDslProfile == null) || !oldAtmProfile.equals(service.getAtmProfile()) || !oldDslProfile.equals(service.getDslProfile())){
        log.warn("execute(): Modify executed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"] even though no profile changes detected.");
    } else {
        log.debug("execute(): Port profiles changed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"]. Writing provision record for port profile modify");
    }

3. if ((oldCtag != port.getCtag()) || (oldStag != port.getStag())) {
        log.debug("execute(): Vlans changed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"]. Writing provision record for vlan modify");
        provisionRecordService.createProvisioningRecordForServlet(service.getPortPairMapping().getPortOpt(), ProvisionRecord.MODIFY, lsip, null, request.getOriginator(), service.getAtmProfile(), service.getDslProfile(), oldCtag, oldStag);
    }

The above logic has been superceded by this:

if (previousValues.atmProfile == null || previousValues.atmProfile.equals("") || previousValues.dslProfile == null || previousValues.dslProfile.equals("")) {
provisionRecordService.createProvisioningRecordForServlet(service.getPortPairMapping().getPortOpt(), ProvisionRecord.MODIFY, lsip, null, originator, service.getAtmProfile(), service.getDslProfile(), 0, 0);
log.debug("execute(): Port profiles changed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"]. Writing provision record for port profile modify");
} else if ((!previousValues.atmProfile.equals(service.getAtmProfile()) || !previousValues.dslProfile.equals(service.getDslProfile())) && (previousValues.stag != port.getStag() || previousValues.ctag != port.getCtag())) {
provisionRecordService.createProvisioningRecordForServlet(service.getPortPairMapping().getPortOpt(), ProvisionRecord.MODIFY, lsip, null, originator, service.getAtmProfile(), service.getDslProfile(), previousValues.ctag, previousValues.stag);
log.debug("execute(): Vlans changed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"]. Writing provision record for vlan modify");
provisionRecordService.createProvisioningRecordForServlet(service.getPortPairMapping().getPortOpt(), ProvisionRecord.MODIFY, lsip, null, originator, service.getAtmProfile(), service.getDslProfile(), 0, 0);
log.debug("execute(): Port profiles changed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"]. Writing provision record for port profile modify");
} else if (!previousValues.atmProfile.equals(service.getAtmProfile()) || !previousValues.dslProfile.equals(service.getDslProfile())) {
provisionRecordService.createProvisioningRecordForServlet(service.getPortPairMapping().getPortOpt(), ProvisionRecord.MODIFY, lsip, null, originator, service.getAtmProfile(), service.getDslProfile(), 0, 0);
log.debug("execute(): Port profiles changed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"]. Writing provision record for port profile modify");
} else if ((previousValues.ctag != port.getCtag()) || (previousValues.stag != port.getStag())) {
provisionRecordService.createProvisioningRecordForServlet(service.getPortPairMapping().getPortOpt(), ProvisionRecord.MODIFY, lsip, null, originator, service.getAtmProfile(), service.getDslProfile(), previousValues.ctag, previousValues.stag);
log.debug("execute(): Vlans changed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"]. Writing provision record for vlan modify");
} else {
provisionRecordService.createProvisioningRecordForServlet(service.getPortPairMapping().getPortOpt(), ProvisionRecord.MODIFY, lsip, null, originator, service.getAtmProfile(), service.getDslProfile(), 0, 0);
log.warn("execute(): Modify executed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"] even though no profile changes detected.");
}

Ok, one last time... This is the simplified even further logic:

if ((!previousValues.atmProfile.equals(service.getAtmProfile()) || (!previousValues.dslProfile.equals(service.getDslProfile()))) && (previousValues.stag != port.getStag() || previousValues.ctag != port.getCtag())) {
provisionRecordService.createProvisioningRecordForServlet(service.getPortPairMapping().getPortOpt(), ProvisionRecord.MODIFY, lsip, null, originator, service.getAtmProfile(), service.getDslProfile(), previousValues.ctag, previousValues.stag);
log.debug("execute(): Vlans changed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"]. Writing provision record for vlan modify");
provisionRecordService.createProvisioningRecordForServlet(service.getPortPairMapping().getPortOpt(), ProvisionRecord.MODIFY, lsip, null, originator, service.getAtmProfile(), service.getDslProfile(), 0, 0);
log.debug("execute(): Port profiles changed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"]. Writing provision record for port profile modify");
} else if (!previousValues.atmProfile.equals(service.getAtmProfile()) || !previousValues.dslProfile.equals(service.getDslProfile())) {
provisionRecordService.createProvisioningRecordForServlet(service.getPortPairMapping().getPortOpt(), ProvisionRecord.MODIFY, lsip, null, originator, service.getAtmProfile(), service.getDslProfile(), 0, 0);
log.debug("execute(): Port profiles changed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"]. Writing provision record for port profile modify");
} else if ((previousValues.ctag != port.getCtag()) || (previousValues.stag != port.getStag())) {
provisionRecordService.createProvisioningRecordForServlet(service.getPortPairMapping().getPortOpt(), ProvisionRecord.MODIFY, lsip, null, originator, service.getAtmProfile(), service.getDslProfile(), previousValues.ctag, previousValues.stag);
log.debug("execute(): Vlans changed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"]. Writing provision record for vlan modify");
} else {
provisionRecordService.createProvisioningRecordForServlet(service.getPortPairMapping().getPortOpt(), ProvisionRecord.MODIFY, lsip, null, originator, service.getAtmProfile(), service.getDslProfile(), 0, 0);
log.warn("execute(): Modify executed for lsip ["+service.getLsip()+"] even though no profile changes detected.");
}

Development complete and demo'ed to Sabu:
